titleStmt.title: James F. Miller to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG1729

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

creation.placeName: New Orleans, New Orleans Parish, Louisiana

body.p:
MAYORALTY, CITY of NEW ORLEANS
State of Louisiana,
MAYORALTY OF NEW ORLEANS
City Hall 10th day of Nov 1863
Sir:

I have the honor to state to your Excellency that Walter H. Peters Esq. of their city is a true and loyal citizen and worthy of your confidence and eminently deserving of position of Commissioner of Deeds for your State.

I am with great respect,
Your Obedeient servant,
James F. Miller
Captain, U.S.A.
Acting Mayor.

His Excellency,
Governor. J. E. Bramlette,
Louisiana
Comr Deeds
Walter H. Peters
apptd. 24th Nov/63
New Orleans
